title: Lotte Reiniger (updated 25.04.09)
description:
Charlotte (Lotte) Reiniger (June 2, 1899 - June 19, 1981) was a German (and later a British) silhouette animator and film director.

She is considered to be the mother of silhouette animation, and is often mentioned among the founders of the animation itself. Besides, her feature "The Adventures of prince Ahmed" is the oldest surviving animated feature in the world. She is the great influence on all later animation since 1920s till now.

These compilation consists of:

1. 19 shorts:

Aladdin and the Magic Lamp (1954)
Cinderella (1922)
Hansel and Gretel (1955)
Jack and the Beanstalk (1955)
Prince Frog (1961)
Puss in Boots (1954)
Snow-white and Rose-red (1954)
Ten Minute Mozart (1930)
The Caliph Stork (1954)
The Death-feigning Chinaman (1928)
The Frog Prince (1954)
The Gallant Little Tailor (1954)
The Golden Goose (1944)
The Little Chimney Sweep (1954)
The Sleeping Beauty (1954)
The Star of Bethlehem (1956)
The Three Wishes (1954)
Thumbelina (1955)

2. Animated feature "The Adventures of prince Achmed" (1926)

3. John Isaacs documentary "The Art of Lotte Reiniger" (1970)
